TI: Dantrolene suppresses the hyperpolarization or outward current observed during anoxia in hippocampal neurons.
AB: Hyperpolarizations, or outward currents, recorded in CA1 pyramidal cells during brief anoxia (2-3 min) (but not postanoxic hyperpolarizations) are markedly reduced (92 +/- 4.8%) by dantrolene sodium, applied by superfusion (10-20 microM). This effect, which is at least partly reversible by prolonged washing, is in keeping with the idea that anoxia activates a Ca2(+)-sensitive K conductance by releasing Ca2+ from internal stores.
AD: Anaesthesia Research Department, McGill University, Montreal, Quebec, Canada.
JT: Canadian journal of physiology and pharmacology
